channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15103] hadoopcheck test should provide diff file showing what's new
item.description:
Currently developer has to go to 'build artifacts' folder to read output from hadoopcheck test.
e.g.
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/98/artifact/patchprocess/patch-javac-2.6.1.txt

hadoopcheck test should provide diff file showing what exactly is new

Thanks to Sean for offline discussion
item.summary: hadoopcheck test should provide diff file showing what's new

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
I found this exception many times... Ted Yu do you know why it happens?

Sean Busbey may know.
Could be related to missing license somewhere.
that means you're missing a license. is that exception happening related to this jira or something else?

Sean Busbey see belows:
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/51/artifact/patchprocess/patch-javac-2.4.0.txt

https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/94/artifact/patchprocess/patch-javac-2.4.0.txt
huh. That means we don't have sufficient license information for the older version. I wonder why this doesn't come up all the time. probably will need to be its own issue.

I've tracked the precommit build problem down when investigating HBASE-15069 and HBASE-15104 runs – this happens on all precommit hbase jobs that run on the H2 machine:

https://builds.apache.org/computer/H2/builds
Here's the related infra ticket. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-11081 Since andrew fixed what I suggested, can you unblacklist so we can see if things are better on subsequent builds?
done. H2 is in the list again.
